availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Bush (Caldwell County, Kentucky, student and second lieutenant (U.S.A))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, student and soldier (U.S.A). Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Son of Reuben R. Bush and Louisa Williams Bush. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from August 14, 1862, to December 5, 1862. Died in military service in Paducah on December 5, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 310b.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 397.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
